image.altText: A satellite view of a mountain, with overlays of magnified regions.

props.synopsis: New satellite imagery shows US stealth bombers appear to have targeted a vulnerable spot in one of Iran's key nuclear sites, buried deep in a mountain.

title.children: Satellite images show impact craters, building damage at Iranian nuclear sites

image.altText: Trump sits at a conference table beside two men in black suits

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces says it has struck six Iranian airports and destroyed military planes, as US President Donald Trump appears to reopen the door on seeking regime change in Iran. Follow live.

title.children: IDF says it has struck six Iranian airports, Iran vows response to US aggression

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: IDF says additional missiles have been fired towards Israel
Sirens sound in Israel as Iran launches another round of strikes, IDF says

image.altText: A serious-looking woman leaning forwards over a document binder open on a desk.

props.synopsis: A professor of international law says there's been an erosion of "international norms" when it comes to the use of force in pre-emptive self-defence.

title.children: 'If the US can do this, why can't we?' Legality of Iran strike questioned

image.altText: People lay on the floor on mattresses in an underground light rail station.

props.synopsis: The streets of Tel Aviv often feel a world away from conflict. But the mood across Israel's largest population hub is subdued, to say the least.

title.children: Israel struck Iran then missiles rained down, sparking new fears

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Blue Room

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says action to prevent Iran from getting a nuclear weapon was acceptable, but that talks should now resume.

title.children: Australia backs US strikes on Iran while urging return to diplomacy

image.altText: A map of the middle east with hundreds of tiny yellow planes. They are flying around Iran Iraq and Israel.

props.synopsis: Flight trackers show airlines are avoiding airspace over Iran, Iraq and Israel, while some have cancelled services to areas on the southern side of the Gulf.

title.children: How the Israel-Iran war is affecting Australian flights

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping shake hands in front of Russia and China's flags

props.synopsis: The US decision to attack Iran has sparked speculation that Tehran's actions will hinge on how its most powerful allies — Russia and China — respond.

title.children: Why China and Russia's forces won't come to Iran's rescue

image.altText: An aerial view of an oil tanker with flames and black smoke coming from one side.

props.synopsis: Markets are betting that Iran has few palatable options to respond to the US bombing its nuclear facilities. But what if its leaders opt for a poison pill for them and the world?

title.children: Iran is threatening an 'economic suicide bomb'. Will a desperate regime set it off?

image.altText: GettyImages-2220804928

props.synopsis: As Minjee Lee won her historic third major, a mention of her golfing brother highlighted the tyranny of distance between the two Australian stars.

title.children: The family message that stood out as Minjee Lee created golf history

image.altText: An oil tanker in the ocean

props.synopsis: Iran has threatened to block the Strait of Hormuz. A disruption of this scale to the world's crucial oil supply could have a significant effect on petrol prices by mid-August.

title.children: What's the Strait of Hormuz and how could a blockage impact fuel prices?

image.altText: A close up of a Hesta sign on a wall.

props.synopsis: An expert says superannuation fund HESTA has failed in its duty of care to customers as dozens report they still cannot access their money.

title.children: HESTA members struggle to access super for surgery, nursing home fees

image.altText: Police and fire and rescue stand around a smashed up car on a tow truck.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are searching for two teenagers they believe were involved in a collision that killed a woman and an unborn baby.

title.children: Horror weekend on NSW roads as national toll hits 15-year high

image.altText: A corridor inside a jail with locked doors.

props.synopsis: Two 'sovereign citizens' are sentenced to a month in jail in Western Australia, with a judge warning their "extremely dangerous" ideas would not be tolerated.

title.children: Two sovereign citizens imprisoned after rejecting legal authority

image.altText: Pink and blue glowing cloud against a backdrop of orange stars.

props.synopsis: A stunning nebula and a sky dotted full of stars and galaxies are in a set of three images released by the Vera C. Rubin Observatory as a taster of more to come.

title.children: First images of space from world's biggest digital camera stun astronomers

image.altText: A woman stands in front of protest placards at a rally in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Hundreds braved Melbourne cold to rally in support of former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte, who is in the custody of the International Criminal Court on charges of crimes against humanity.

title.children: Duterte 'stick thin' in Hague prison, daughter tells rally in Australia

image.altText: Jim Chalmers blue room

props.synopsis: Labor’s timidity may finally be evaporating but the backlash over tax reform is coming and it could get ugly.

title.children: 'Boomers beware' threat won't cut it as government opens door to tax reforms

image.altText: Mid shot of Rachael Gunn wearing Olympic uniform, blurred out crowd behind, pulling face and throwing hands forward.

props.synopsis: There's an elite club of Olympic losers who we love to celebrate. A year on from Raygun's infamous performance, Australian Story investigates why she isn't one of them.

title.children: Why Raygun hit a nerve —and what it says about all of us

image.altText: The hull of the superyacht Bayesian hangs fully out of the water

props.synopsis: The British-flagged luxury yacht has been underwater since it sunk off the coast of Sicily in August.

title.children: Inside the 'delicate' operation to hoist sunken superyacht to the surface

image.altText: Alex Caruso steals the ball from Pascal Siakam

props.synopsis: A heartbreaking injury ends Tyrese Haliburton's magical playoff run as Lu Dort's 'moonball' and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's MVP mastery decides Game 7 of an epic NBA Finals. Here are your quick hits from a thrilling series finale.

title.children: Quick hits: Injury heartbreak, 'moonball' and an MVP's masterclass decide epic NBA finale

image.altText: Will sitting at a coffee shop with a pot of tea in front of him.

props.synopsis: The family of William Taylor, a 28-year-old who was killed when a stolen vehicle driven by a teenager collided with his car in Melbourne's south-east a year ago, tells a court his death was "completely avoidable".

title.children: Beloved son's death in stolen car crash 'completely avoidable', family says

image.altText: Smiling girl with glasses eating apple and looking at laptop.

props.synopsis: People share a lot of their lives on social media and that can even include digestion details, with content about "staying regular", bloating and fibre far from off-limits.

title.children: 'Australians don't eat enough legumes': How to get the fibre you need

image.altText: A man leaves court after appearing on animal cruelty charge.

props.synopsis: Three men pleaded guilty to animal cruelty in the Kalgoorlie Magistrates Court after the RSPCA found footage of the men filming a pigeon being bludgeoned to death.

title.children: Pigeon killer must pay $48k, one of WA's largest animal cruelty fines

image.altText: A banner hanging on a bridge in Venice that says no space for Bezos

props.synopsis: The billionaire is set to hold an opulent three-day wedding in Venice this week. And some locals are not happy about it.

title.children: The eye-watering details of Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's Venice wedding

image.altText: A bird's eye view of emergency services vehicles parked near a bus that has stopped in the middle of the road

props.synopsis: A Transperth bus driver has been charged with careless driving after a fatal collision with a pedestrian in the CBD.

title.children: Transperth bus driver charged after fatal collision with pedestrian

image.altText: AC/DC's Angus Young performs live, wearing blue schoolboy outfit and playing black guitar, at London's Wembley Stadium

props.synopsis: The Australian rock icons return home to play five stadium-sized shows in November and December.

title.children: AC/DC announce first Australian shows in a decade

image.altText: Police cordon off a road near bushlad

props.synopsis: A man has been jailed after he shot dead a father-of-two in an incident that triggered an emergency lockdown in Perth's eastern fringes.

title.children: Man jailed for shooting death of father-of-two in Wooroloo

image.altText: Maria Sakkari and Yulia Putintseva clash at the net

props.synopsis: Yulia Putintseva is no stranger to a bizarre post-match handshake drama and has done it again. After a fiery clash with Maria Sakkari, here is a look at the Kazakh's lengthy rap sheet, which features run-ins with fans and officials as well.

title.children: 'Nobody likes you': Tennis's ultimate villain extends lengthy rap sheet with latest bizarre clash

image.altText: A man with shaved head and moustache, wearing black tshirt, folds arms and looks to side smiling with mouth closed.

props.synopsis: Holden Sheppard was feeling frustrated by restrictions of young adult fiction, and by being told he couldn't write about certain things. This time he's written a novel for adults, and he's pleased that nothing has got in his way.

title.children: WA author pens 'gay bogan love story' that's also about male loneliness

image.altText: Survivor Richard Tempest sitting with volunteers at the Childers Cultural Centre in June 2000

props.synopsis: Richard Tempest was expecting to start his first day of work on a zucchini farm when he was jolted out of his sleep 25 years ago by loud smashing sounds. That's when the former UK backpacker noticed the flames and "intense heat" coming from downstairs.

title.children: Australia's deadliest hostel fire still 'very vivid' 25 years on

image.altText: A baby girl in a pink jumpsuit

props.synopsis: The mother of a seven-month-old girl with a congenital heart condition who died at Royal Darwin Hospital after waiting nine hours to see a doctor is suing the hospital for negligence.

title.children: Mother whose baby died after nine-hour wait for help sues Darwin hospital

image.altText: A man in suit and tie standing in front of a wooden wall

props.synopsis: The head of a local government advocacy organisation is in court this week for an intervention order hearing over allegations of harassment.

title.children: Council Watch head fights mayor's bid for intervention order

image.altText: An aerial view of a collection of high-rise buildings, with a lake in the foreground and Telstra Tower in the background.

props.synopsis: Almost nine out of 10 blocks of land to be released for residential development across Canberra by 2030 will be for multi-unit housing — an announcement industry representatives say strikes the right balance for the future of housing.

title.children: Standalone houses or multi-unit buildings: What's the right ratio?

image.altText: The seven members of BTS wearing yellow suits and holding three American Music awards

props.synopsis: Suga's discharge from the South Korean military on the weekend means all members of the K-pop group BTS have now completed the country's mandatory national service.

title.children: Last remaining member of BTS discharged from military

image.altText: Alleged assault on a Brisbane bus

props.synopsis: He is accused of punching a 46-year-old man multiple times on a city council bus at South Bank station on Friday night.

title.children: Man charged with assault after alleged attack of Brisbane bus driver

image.altText: Kerrie Carroll who ran the Lucky Stars Sanctuary in Wootton sits on a lounge with a white cat

props.synopsis: In 2023, Clint Seares's partner Kerrie Carroll died by suicide the day after being discharged after a previous attempt. He is worried the system still has not changed.

title.children: Kerrie left hospital clutching medication. She died 36 hours later
